title: ICE: called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value, compiler/rustc_metadata/src/rmeta/decoder.rs

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
This happened when `cargo build` substrate (https://github.com/paritytech/substrate)

### Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.63.0 (4b91a6ea7 2022-08-08) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
```

`OS Info`:
```
$ cat /etc/os-release
NAME="CentOS Linux"
VERSION="7 (Core)"
ID="centos"
ID_LIKE="rhel fedora"
VERSION_ID="7"
PRETTY_NAME="CentOS Linux 7 (Core)"
ANSI_COLOR="0;31"
CPE_NAME="cpe:/o:centos:centos:7"
HOME_URL="https://www.centos.org/"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.centos.org/"

CENTOS_MANTISBT_PROJECT="CentOS-7"
CENTOS_MANTISBT_PROJECT_VERSION="7"
REDHAT_SUPPORT_PRODUCT="centos"
REDHAT_SUPPORT_PRODUCT_VERSION="7"
```

### Error output

```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler/rustc_metadata/src/rmeta/decoder.rs:1382:75
```
